Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> @gigamesh It is normal... you can add the address you got in lite mode, by clicking `import key` and entering your seed phrase...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Your address and all itâ€™s transactions will be added to your native wallet and able to stake.

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> The wallet.dat in windows is located in a different location. Not sure where on mac but I'm pretty sure it's a similar set up. Agama calls to two other important folders where important data is held. In win they're called "agama" and "komodo" folders. Gimme a sec, I'll do a quick search and see if I can get better OS X info

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> Linux: ~/.komodo

OS X: ~/Library/Application Support/Komodo

Windows: %AppData%/Komodo

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <gigamesh> found it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> Pretty sure VRSC folder has it's own wallet.dat, might wanna make sure

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> Oh ok. Good

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <gigamesh> /komodo/vrsc/wallet.dat

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <gigamesh> thanks, so i can backup the wallet.dat but not set a password

Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> Ok in agama settings you should be able to import private keys for each address individually but really in my opinion the wallet.dat is the better way anyway

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> Not necessarily. No real concerns except from the usual basic protection. Don't allow external access or anything

I would like to have a seed phrase for native if poss.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ABK> What is the general thinking behind the quick initial release of coins, followed by the supply tapering off? For example, seems that the next block lasts 2 years or so and rewards are halved, so the supply increases quickly at first then slows down considerably  as time goes by

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> I must check the white paper for that...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Patrick Crypto> There is still a long time before the next halving

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Patrick Crypto> a year and a half?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Patrick Crypto> And early rewards are randomly time locked

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jintaa> @ABK - I had concerns about that as well, and I've addressed them here before- I was afraid that a small grp of us early adopters would end up with this disproportionately large share of the total amount moving forward=oligopoly=less effective, less revolutionary cryptocurrency. @miketout is not worried about this because he feels with the imminent release of PBaaS and merge mining, our early accumulation will be redistributed to newcoming miners and stakers. Also, upon further consideration, I guess I took a look at Bitcoin and realized over 17m of the total 21m are already mined/released, and that's just in the 1st 10 years of its existence. So relative to the mother of all cryptos, I guess VRSC isn't too dissimilar.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Oink> @ABK the answer is found on page 21 of the Vision Paper:

During the first 5 months, Verus will have an accelerated reward curve for mining and staking, with a halving every month. During the first two months, when the block rewards are at or above 192 Verus, mined blocks will have time locked coinbase transactions, preventing spending, staking, or transferring of those coins for a period that varies from approximately 3 months after the genesis block, based on numbers of blocks, to 2 years and 3 months. These time locked coins provide a smooth release of the Verus currency supply as well as incentive to all of their owners to support the long term success of the Verus network and project.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> And too much coins generated (in general) equals devaluation...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jintaa> @Oink -I think that section doesn't address the concern here. 2 years and 3months is nothing in the grand scheme of such a long term/forward looking project. The concern here is ending up right back at the problem that a "no pre-mine" crypto project was aiming to avoid in the first place. I'm not saying I know for sure it is an issue with Verus, I'm just saying I see the potential for this issue, and think it bears examination.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Oink> @jintaa that section covers the question from @ABK just fine. It just doesnâ€™t cover your concerns, which I havenâ€™t addressed.
As for your concerns: the presence of large mining farms becoming whales is imho a far greater concern when looking forward, since they destabilize the decentralization.
As for the oligopoly you mention: that it s only a financial position. Without having any backing technology to enforce changes or decisions, itâ€™s worthless.
I am also confident that a number of investors will release (some of) their coins, once the price of Verus rises sufficiently for them to make a descent profit, thus spreading those coins publicly.
I agree with the vision that after pBaaS is released, the demand for VRSC will grow and the price will rise.
Finally, but most important: a pre-mine will render only the developers with a stash of coins, the mechanism used here avoids that. The developers and the early adopters take a proportional share of the early coins.
Since the early coins are not confined to a closed group, like with pre-mining, it is unjustifiable to use the word oligopoly in this context.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jintaa> It's a matter of degree. The fact that the majority of the early rewards go to 200 early investors as opposed to 20 developers is just a matter of one instance being slightly less bad. THAT'S JUST AN EXAMPLE TO ILLUSTRATE MY POINT. I'm not saying that's the case here. But to say the oligopoly concern is unjustifiable I don't think understands what I'm asking. In any case, the debate at this point is academic: I'm not divesting from Verus anytime soon, and neither is any of us here, so I continue to cheer the team, the community members and the ecosystem on, as always.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Bear in mind that an early supply of coins was a necessity in order to make POS work... network would have been awfully vulnerable without it.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jintaa> ok, I see.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> But I fully agree on not dumping my VRSC soon, despite the fact that I got onboard only 2 months ago
